plots: there are five empty chests
a famous person will appear in front of each empty chest: each famous person will give the player a gift that belongs to another famous person and will give a hint about the gift's owner
the player must place each gift to the correct chest behind each famous person

quest.title: Game of the Imps
quest.objective: play the imps' game
tasks: place the gifts, and talk to the imps
quest.description:
We are two imps, little demonic people. We want to play a game.
Okay, big peoples... this is how our game will go! There is five chests here with nothings in them! In front of each empty chest, a famous big people will appear! Famous big people! Oh, yes, powerful famous big people! Each famous big people will give you a gift that belongs to another famous big people... and they will hints to you what gifts belong to them! If you thinks you knows which famous big people a gift belongs to, you puts it in the empty chest behind them, yes? Very simple!
Once you places all five, you comes and asks us! If you wrong, we laugh at you! If you right, we open the sixth chest! The sixth chest has all of the drow's treasure! All of it!

TESO355: a nobleman who rules over Skingrad

plots: Count Hassildor of Skingrad contacted the Council of Mages: he has important information
Count Hassildor has asked for the player, specifically

quest.title: Information at a Price
quest.objective: receive vital information from Count Hassildor
tasks: receive vital information from Count Hassildor
quest.description:
There is an urgent matter which requires your personal attention. This task falls to you, and only you.
Count Hassildor of Skingrad has contacted the Council. He claims to have information that is vital to us. He has requested that you personally travel to Skingrad to obtain this information. I cannot stress how important it is that our relationship with Hassildor be preserved. I expect you to visit him immediately.
I am unsure as to why he has requested that you, of all people, should be the one to visit him. I have no wish to put you in harm's way.
Please, travel there as soon as possible. The Count is waiting for you.

TESS227: the dead male leader of the Companions

plots: Kodlak's final teaching: those with beastblood cannot enter Sovngarde
the player has a head of the Glenmoril that is needed to cure lycanthropy

quest.title: Purity
quest.objective: handle Vilkas' personal troubles
tasks: help Vilkas give up his beastblood
quest.description:
There is always work for the Companions. But there is more personal task before me.
Kodlak's final teaching is troubling me. I think he was right about beastblood and Sovngarde. I wish to cleanse myself that I might know glory in the afterlife.
Will you help me give up my beasthood? You still bear a head of the Glenmoril betrayers, yes? Then lead on, back to the Tomb of Ysgramor.
My soul is now prepared.

TESS192: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known
TESS193: the female guildmaster of the Dark Brotherhood

plots: Astrid told the player about killing the Gourmet and taking his identity
the player should hide the Gourmet's body if they can

quest.title: Recipe for Death
quest.objective: assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
tasks: question Anton Virane to learn the true identity of the Gourmet, and kill Anton Virane
assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
quest.description:
Let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope? That you need to kill him and take on his identity?
But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
You are to obtain that information from Virane - who the Gourmet really is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that.
As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better.
Now off with you!

TL271: an immortal spirit who covets the remains of the living

plots: the player has summoned Fade: the player wants to enter Cacklespit's Realm

quest.title: Cacklespit's Realm
quest.objective: bring 4 skulls of famous warriors to Fade
tasks: bring 4 skulls of famous warriors to Fade
quest.description:
I am Fade - why have you summoned me?
Ah, you want to enter Cacklespit's hidden realm. Yes, I know the way - but I do not provide service without compensation.
I have very particular... appetites. The remains of the living are infused with a lingering residue of deeds past, which sustains me. Bring me the skulls of four warriors of renown, and I will take you where you wish to go. This battlefield is littered with the bones of great heroes. Your search should not be difficult.

BG2244: a wizard merchant with magical wares, and a newcomer in this town

plots: Lazarus Librarus' does not have anything for the player to purchase
Lazarus Librarus' spellbook was stolen: he cannot fashion scrolls without his spellbook
Lazarus Librarus suspected Hectan, but he was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft

quest.title: Lazarus' Missing Spellbook
quest.objective: return Lazarus Librarus' spellbook to him
tasks: return Lazarus Librarus' spellbook to him
quest.description:
Lazarus Librarus at your service. I would normally invite you to look at my magical wares, but alas, my shelves are completely bare. I have not even a single parchment left for you to purchase.
My spellbook has been stolen! Without it, I cannot fashion the powerful scrolls which normally fill my shop. Please, mighty traveler... I beg of you to help a humble wizard! At first, I suspected Hectan... he is well known about town for his sticky fingers. But after questioning many witnesses, it is clear that Hectan was at the local pub from dusk until dawn the night of the theft. I still suspect that no-good thief Hectan was involved — I can clearly see the guilt in his face! But there is no proof. Without my spellbook, I am virtually powerless to pursue this myself, and as a newcomer to this town, I have no one to turn to for help.
I regret that there is little else I can tell you. Hectan can usually be found in the Tankard Tree if you wish to question him.
I urge you godspeed.

TESS564: the god of infection and pestilence

plots: the player asked Kesh the Clean about speaking with Peryite
deathbell grow in the frozen tundra
the player might find the ruby and silver in a mine
vampire dust comes from vampires

quest.title: An Ill Meeting
quest.objective: make incense with Kesh the Clean
tasks: gather a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust for making the incense
make incense with Kesh the Clean
quest.description:
Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. But Kesh likes you, friend.
There is a way Peryite may speak to us who will take Him in. If you wish to commune with Him, we'll need the incense. Fetch for me a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust. Then I will show you how.
How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

TESS958: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
TESS959: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar
TESS960: a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it
TESS961: the queen of the night sky, a goddess
Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

plots: Azura has given Aranea Ienith the gift of foresight

quest.title: The Black Star
quest.objective: become the champion of Azura
tasks: ask around about an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night
quest.description:
Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.
Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.

MC58: a mysterious, hard to reach dimension
MC59: strange fruits that might teleport the player a short distance when eaten

plots: Kevin wants knowledge

quest.title: A More Than Exotic Fruit
quest.objective: bring 6 Chorus Fruits to Kevin
quest.description:
Traveler! Did you know that our dimension is one among many. There exists a dimension called "The End". It is a mysterious place, and supposedly hard to reach.
I yearn to know more about that dimension. I have heard vague rumors about fruits native to the End that might teleport you a tiny distance when digested. They are called Chorus Fruits.
If you get your hands on six Chorus Fruits, I promise to reward you well with 12 diamonds. Please help a man sate his ever-growing curiosity.

plots: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold

quest.title: Magic Student
quest.objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
quest.description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

TESS867: a farm owned by Hillevi Cruel-Sea's family

plots: Hillevi Cruel-Sea's goods are grown at Hollyfrost Farm

quest.title: Who to Poison?
quest.objective: deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
tasks: deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
quest.description:
Everything you see is grown at my family's own Hollyfrost Farm. Fresh and filling.
I also do a little herb growing. The court wizard, Wuunferth, pays us to plant a little Nightshade. Who knows what he uses it for? A poison like that?
Hey, could you deliver this bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth?

plots: the player told Maramal that the player wants to get married
these are difficult times

quest.title: The Bonds of Matrimony
quest.objective: get married
tasks: attend your wedding tomorrow, from dawn until dusk
quest.description:
Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

plots: the gatekeeper won't let Farthing go and get her doll

quest.title: Farthing's Dolly
quest.objective: return Farthing's doll to her
quest.description:
My name's Farthing. I'm only five. In a few years my papa will let me hunt. Are you allowed to hunt?
I've lost my dolly out in the woods. The gatekeeper won't let me go and get it. Can you get it for me?

BG2106: in the north side of this chamber
BG2107: in the north side of this chamber
in the north side of this chamber
BG2108: in the north side of this chamber

plots: Aerie works in the circus with Quayle
there's an illusion that makes Aerie look like a monster
Aerie has been chained: the key to her chains looks like a sword
the commoners have the key
Aerie regains her normal form after becoming free

quest.title: Set Aerie Free
quest.objective: free Aerie
tasks: get the key to Aerie's chains from commoners
quest.description:
M-my name is Aerie. I... work in the circus with my uncle, Quayle... I... I'm not a monster! I'm an elf, a winged elf... or at least I was... This... this covering you see is some kind of illusion, but if you believe in it, then it becomes real! P-please believe me! Now go before something happens to you, I beg of you!
If... if you're not going to flee, then maybe you can help free me from the chains that keep me bound in this form — and then maybe I can help you!
You... you need the key to these chains. But... but it won't look like a key! There are a couple of... commoners... in the north side of this chamber...
Don't be fooled by the illusion, though... they are monsters! They have a sword which is actually my key... if you get it from them, I can remove the chain and regain my normal form!
But please be careful! You... you can't trust anything you see here!

plots: Bodhi wants to break a monopoly in this town
the shipment of supplies arrives by boat: if the player does not get the shipment of supplies in the next few days, the player will fail

quest.title: Breaking a Monopoly
quest.objective: weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves
tasks: steal the shipment of supplies belonging to the Shadow Thieves
weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves
quest.description:
I am Bodhi, and I greet you warmly.
There is a monopoly in this town, and I intend to break it. I will ask you to weaken the "resources" of the Shadow Thieves. I wish a campaign of disruption, and you will begin it. There is a shipment of supplies arriving by boat. You are to... confiscate it.
I suggest you move against that ship coming in. They won't be at the docks for long, and if you do not get the cargo in the next few days, you will fail.
Farewell and good fortune.

plots: the player showed Trill-Bot 4000 a robot component

quest.title: Getting One's Bearings
quest.objective: find the Azimuthoscope
tasks: follow the trail of Trill-Bot 4000's parts
quest.description:
I believe you have found one of my missing components! There appears to be a trail of them, leading toward that dungeon.
If you follow the trail of my Parts, it might lead you to my Azimuthoscope: the component I need to direct you to another treasure trove!

plots: wants conquest
the player is a known villain

quest.title: Dark Rule
quest.objective: conquer Desert Refuge
tasks: kill all villagers who oppose you
quest.description:
Master, the desert village of Desert Refuge is ripe for taking! Your dark domain will grow vastly, if you were to conquer it!
Master, you should go to Desert Refuge, and kill all villagers you oppose you! The ones who don't, on the contrary, should make terrific new minions for you!

TESS58: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

plots: the player and Brynjolf did a little thievery at the market

quest.title: Taking Care of Business
quest.objective: send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
tasks: collect some debts from Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand, and Haelga without killing them
send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
quest.description:
Well, well... Color me impressed kid. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? They are Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga.
They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.

plots: the rings of blood magic increase the abilities of the player's vampiric powers: Molag Bal supposedly gave the rings to vampires

quest.title: Rings of Blood Magic
quest.objective: retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
tasks: retrieve the Ring of the Erudite
retrieve the Ring of the Beast
retrieve a set of ancient rings of blood magic for yourself
quest.description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient rings of Blood Magic: the Ring of the Erudite in Swindler's Den and the Ring of the Beast in Cragwallow Slope. They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

plots: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire whether he is the only wizard in Whiterun: Farengar Secret-Fire is the only wizard, but Whiterun is also home to a priest, a priestess, and alchemist, and others

quest.title: Salt for Arcadia
quest.objective: deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
tasks: give the frost salts to Arcadia, the local alchemist
deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
quest.description:
I believe I am, yes. Technically speaking, of course. The city is also home to a priest, a priestess, an alchemist, and I'm sure others who practice. Ah, that reminds me. Speaking of alchemists, I have some frost salts for Arcadia. She asked me to obtain them for one of her potions.
Would you be so kind as to deliver the frost salts for me? I'm sure Arcadia will provide some form of recompense…

TESS186: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood
TESS187: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known
TESS188: a fellow Dark Brotherhood member, a man

plots: the Gourmet is the last target before he Dark Brotherhood strikes out at the emperor: the Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the emperor at a special dinner
Festus is close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet

quest.title: Recipe for Disaster
quest.objective: kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
tasks: kill the Gourmet, steal his writ of passage, and assume his identity
quest.description:
There's just one more target before we strike out at the Emperor.
Have you by chance heard of the "Gourmet"? Read his cookbook? It's become quite a phenomenon. The Gourmet is scheduled to cook for the Emperor at a special dinner.
You'll kill him, steal his Writ of Passage, and assume the role of master chef. Festus has been spearheading this part of the assassination plan. He's close to uncovering the identity of the Gourmet.
You should report to him.

MC103: [Enemy] green monsters that sneak up on people and try to blow them up along with them
MC104: a special bow crafted by Jack

plots: Jack wants knowledge

quest.title: Bowing Down Creepers
quest.objective: test out the Awesome Bow, and report back to Jack
tasks: kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow
test out the Awesome Bow, and report back to Jack
quest.description:
I'm a fletcher. Bows and arrows are my domain.
In fact, I've just crafted a special Bow I've dubbed the "Awesome Bow". I just need someone to test it out.
You could be just the right person for the job. Go, and kill 15 Creepers with the Awesome Bow. I friggin' hate those green suicide bombing monsters! I'll have 32 emeralds for you, as a tester's fee.

plots: Big Head will give the player his charm so that the player can speak with Bolwing

quest.title: The Fork of Horripilation
quest.objective: find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
tasks: talk to Bolwing to hear his secret
find the Fork of Horripilation for Big Head
quest.description:
Sing for Big Head.
The Fork for Big Head. Oh, where has Master put the Fork? It sings alone. Far from home. Sad, sad Fork. Sad, sad Big Head.
The Fork! The precious, precious fork! Hear how it sings to Big Head! Beautiful, perfect Fork of Horripilation! But it is gone. Gone, gone, gone. No more singing. No more ringing. Taken from Big Head, never returned. That is when Big Head came here. Master brought me! Whispered shouts into my ear! Songs of Madgods! Songs of bad gods! Softly, Master. Softly.
It went away. But it will come back! It always comes back! It is close. Big Head can hear it! The Fork of Horripilation! Hear it singing! Songs of home! It comes again. It brings presents! It is not present. Soon it will be! You will find it! Bring the Fork! Hear the music. Music of toads. Music of roads! Sing to yourself, so all can hear!
Talk to the beggar! Talk to Bolwing! He knows secrets, but no one can hear them. No one but Big Head. Take Big Head's charm! Listen to Bolwing! His tongue is tied, but his mind is unraveled! He'll tell you the secret. Who has the Fork?

plots: Roe went on a business trip to Amn

quest.title: Mirianne's Husband
quest.objective: tell Mirianne whether you found information about Roe or not
tasks: tell Mirianne whether you found information about Roe or not
quest.description:
My husband had to make a sudden business trip to Amn and I'm so worried for him.
"Mirianne," he always said, "Mirianne, who knows the road better than old Roe?" But the highways just aren't as safe as they once were and there hasn't been a messenger from Amn here in months.
Could you keep your eyes open along the southern roads and let me know if you find anything?

TESO135: a mace, and Maeva the Buxom's family heirloom

plots: Bjalfi the Contemptible snatched Rockshatter, and took off to join a local marauder gang at Fort Strand

quest.title: When the Vow Breaks
quest.objective: recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
tasks: recover the Rockshatter for Maeva the Buxom
quest.description:
Perhaps you can help me. I'm Maeva the Buxom. My husband's name is Bjalfi the Contemptible. My father said I was a fool to marry him, but I didn't listen. At our wedding, my father gave us a family heirloom as a gift; Rockshatter, a mace that's been in my family for many generations.
Bjalfi snatched Rockshatter from our mantle and took off to "find his fortune" with the local Marauder gang at Fort Strand. I want that mace back. Please, I don't think he's ever coming back, and I'd hate to lose such a precious heirloom to a gang of thugs.

plots: the player drove Rieklings away from Halbarn Iron-Fur's forge

quest.title: Materials for Smithing
quest.objective: bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
tasks: bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
quest.description:
Cleaning out the forge was the easy part. But those blasted Rieklings made off with most of my materials. And I can't forge air.
You tend to wander around, don't you? If you come across any Stalhrim or Ebony in your travels, bring them back to old Halbarn. Help each other out.

TESS55: the only person who can defeat dragons for good

plots: the player is Dragonborn

quest.title: Dragon Hunting
quest.objective: kill a dragon with the Blades
tasks: ask Esbern to send the Blades to the dragon
kill a dragon with the Blades
quest.description:
The Blades of the old hunted down many dragons in their day, and they have records of where the beasts lived.
Only you can truly defeat these monsters, Dragonborn, but you do not have to do so alone. The Blades can help you.
Just ask whenever you're ready to take on a dragon. We will send the Blades to help you fulfill your destiny. The dragon's soul should make you stronger.

plots: the player asked a recommendation from Kud-Ei
Varon Vamori stole Ardaline's mage's staff
Kud-Ei gives the player a scroll with a powerful Illusion charm spell

quest.title: Mixed Feelings
quest.objective: recover Ardaline's mage's staff
tasks: charm Varon Vamori and make him tell you where Ardaline's mage's staff is
quest.description:
I'm afraid I haven't had time to prepare anything conventional for your recommendation. I'm very preoccupied with this situation concerning Ardaline.
Perhaps you can help with that, however. I can't directly get involved, for fear of embarrassing the poor girl. Varon Vamori's been bothering Ardaline every day for a while now. He even stole her Mages' Staff! Perhaps he thinks it's amusing; I don't know. But it needs to stop. It's making her miserable.
I'll need you to have a little chat with Varon Vamori to get Ardaline's staff back, and you can learn something about the power of Illusion in the process. Take this charm scroll. With it, you should find Varon more receptive to questioning.
Don't come back without that staff. I'll write you a recommendation for your help.

TESO440: an old warrior turned farmer, and a worried father
TESO442: Valus Odiil, Rallus and Antus' farm, not far from Chorrol

plots: Rallus may know more about the creatures that attacked the Odiil Farm

quest.title: The Killing Field
quest.objective: reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
tasks: meet up with Rallus and Antus
reclaim the Odiil Farm from the creatures of the Great Forest with Rallus and Antus
quest.description:
My sons! Have you seen my sons Rallus and Antus? They're going to fight off the creatures at our farm, but I fear for their safety.
For the last few days, we've suffered attacks from these creatures at our farm not far from Chorrol. They're coming from someplace in the Great Forest. I don't know where, but Rallus may know more by now. My boys will take up the fight even if the guards won't. Doesn't matter if it's outside the town walls - it still affects us all. They expect me to go with them, but... I fear in my old age, I'm not the warrior I once was. Would you... would you go in my place?
I'm supposed to meet them at Weynon Priory. You'd best get whatever supplies you need now, so you can get there in time.
I... I need a drink to calm my nerves. Please, excuse me.

plots: Commander Vale believes that the Alchemist might attack the Wellspring Temple: the Alchemist wants to reach the Guardian of Water

quest.title: Protect the Guardian!
quest.objective: protect the Guardian of Water
quest.description:
Commander Vale believes that the Alchemist might attack the Wellspring Temple, in an attempt to reach the Guardian of Water ... for what nefarious purpose I am afraid to speculate. There has been no word from either Vale, or the Guardian.
Scout the Wellspring Temple, and determine if the Guardian of Water is in any danger.

plots: Malaaq was bound to guard Irenicus' items and the player's weapon
Malaaq was captured from his home, Plane of Air, by Irenicus
Malaaq will be free if he is given his original flask

quest.title: Free the Genie
quest.objective: return Malaaq's flask to him
quest.description:
I am djinni Malaaq and I have been bound by a wizard to guard his items, and your item it seems. I can sense your touch upon this weapon.
If you can secure the means of my release, I will give you your weapon.
I was captured in my home, on Plane of Air, by some wizard. He bound me to this flask that I might guard his things. You must find my original flask and bring it back to me. Once it is within my grasp, I can break the enchantment and be freed.

plots: Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife traveled away and went missing

quest.title: Colquetle's Family
quest.objective: find out what happened to Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
tasks: find Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
find out what happened to Mr. Colquetle's son and his wife
quest.description:
What cruel whim of the fates controls this torment of me?!
I, Mr. Colquetle, have heard nothing from my son and his wife for nigh unto a week now, and all else pales in importance until I do. I should have known better than to allow his travel in these dangerous times.

TESS193: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood, a man

plots: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Cicero went berserk because he overheard Astrid complain about the Night Mother and the player being the listener: Cicero wounded Veezara and tried to kill Astrid before fleeing

quest.title: The Cure for Madness
quest.objective: confront Cicero and kill him
tasks: find Arnbjorn and make sure he is alright
search Cicero's room for clues about where he has gone and let Astrid know about your findings
quest.description:
The fool Cicero went absolutely berserk! He wounded Veezara, tried to kill me, and then he fled. I knew that lunatic couldn't be trusted.
Nothing set Cicero off. At least nothing I'm aware of. Well... If I'm being honest, I haven't exactly been discreet lately in expressing my frustration with this whole situation. Obeying the Night Mother. You being the Listener. It's ridiculous. No offense. Cicero may have overheard me talking to one of the others about the Night Mother. It's possible I was... not entirely respectful. But to go this far. To attempt to murder the leader of a Sanctuary. Cicero must pay with his life. There is no other option.
I want you to find that miserable little fool and end his life! But first... find my husband. Make sure he's all right. After the attack, Arnbjorn flew into a rage. When Cicero left... Arnbjorn went after him. They disappeared into the wild. Take my horse, Shadowmere. You'll find him outside, by the pool, when you go find Arnbjorn. Search Cicero's room here. Maybe there's something in there that sheds some light on where he might have gone.
Let me know the minute you find something. I've got to see to Veezara, and calm everyone down.

TESO553: a famous man related to the history of smithing

plots: the player asked smithing training from Gin-Wulm

quest.title: Smithing Training
quest.objective: answer Gin-Wulm what the name Hazadir means, proving Gin-Wulm that you know about the history of smithing
tasks: find a book about Hazadir to find the answer
answer Gin-Wulm what the name Hazadir means, proving Gin-Wulm that you know about the history of smithing
quest.description:
Mighty bold of you, asking for smithing training. What makes you think you're worth my time?
I bet you don't know the first thing about smithing. Have you read up on the history of the craft? I doubt it. You answer a simple question, and I'll think about training you.
So here it is: What does the name Hazadir mean to you? Few recognize the name anymore, even though he was famous.
Had a book written about him, in fact! I don't have a copy myself, but there was one in First Edition last time I was browsing there. At least some people take an interest in history.

TL239: a man who has Ordrak's Heart

plots: Ordrak's Heart wreaking havoc
the Guardian wants the player to go to the Ossean Wastes

quest.title: Return to the Enclave
quest.objective: stop the Alchemist before it's too late
tasks: go to the Ossean Wastes with the help of Commander Vale
stop the Alchemist before it's too late
quest.description:
I don't know if the Alchemist understands that Ordrak's Heart is wreaking such havoc... or if he just doesn't care! I hope there's still a chance to stop him, one way or another, before it's too late.
So the Guardian wants you to head to the Ossean Wastes? You know what? I think I can help you with that...

plots: Sam wants reputation

quest.title: A Tour in Hell
quest.objective: explore the Nether with Sam
tasks: go to the Nether with Sam
quest.description:
I really want to see something more interesting than the bounds of this village. That would also elevate my status among the other villagers.
Traveler, can you take me to the Nether? I want see that hellish realm myself, but I can't fend off its dangers all by myself. Let us explore the place together.
You will also get a fair reward for being my guide in the Nether: 10 diamonds. Don't spend them all at once.

plots: Matt wants comfort

quest.title: Pests Be Come
quest.objective: take care of the Endermites that have been bothering the villagers
tasks: take care of the Endermites that have been bothering the villagers
quest.description:
Some incredibly foolish individual's been throwing Ender Pearls all over our village! Now the whole place is crawling with Endermites!
Could you take care of those little critters before they cause any serious issues? Kill them all, and receive 16 golden carrots for your trouble. You would have all our thanks, too.

TESS587: a Skaal man in a bad mood
TESS588: a Skaal man, the only blacksmith in the Skaal village

plots: Baldor Iron-Shaper is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim
Deor Woodcutter saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them in the woods on the day Baldor Iron-Shaper disappeared: the elves went south and west

quest.title: A New Source of Stalhrim
quest.objective: find Baldor Iron-Shaper
tasks: search for any sign of Baldor
quest.description:
I am in no mood to talk, outsider. One of the Skaal has gone missing. It is Baldor Iron-Shaper. As our only smith, Baldor is very important to the village.
Baldor is the keeper of an ancient tradition, the forging of Stalhrim. It is an art we Skaal hold sacred. If someone wanted to make such weapons, they would have to get that knowledge from Baldor.
I did see something in the woods on the day he disappeared. I saw two elves in the far distance, dragging something behind them. Hunters often visit our lands, so I thought little of it.
The elves went south and west. If your road takes you that way, perhaps you could search for any sign of Baldor. The Skaal would be grateful.

TL253: a spirit of an ambitious thief
TL255: an artifact that has power over water

plots: Edovar stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin: he died while trying to use the Glyph of Balthazar and was trapped drowning forever

quest.title: Wash Away My Sins
quest.objective: set Edovar free
quest.description:
I am merely spirit, but I mean you no harm. In life, I was an ambitious thief, and I thought I was invincible. My greatest achievement was when I stole the Glyph of Balthazar from the Wellspring Basin. I thought I could master its power over water, but I was very, very wrong.
Now I am trapped here in eternal torment, drowning forever, unable to rectify my mistake. Will you return the Glyph of Balthazar to the Wellspring Basin, and set my spirit free at last?
